snippet.title: Corneal reflex \- Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
snippet.description: The corneal reflex, also known as the blink reflex, is an involuntary blinking of the eyelids elicited by stimulation of the cornea (such as by touching or by a foreign body), or bright light, though could result from any peripheral stimulus.
